abstracts.cdata!:
The Tax Administration Technical
            Assistance Loan Project seeks to assist Guatemala in raising
            its revenue performance above historically low rates by:
            improving the effectiveness and efficiency of tax and
            customs administration; increasing tax revenues; and
            achieving stronger revenue performance. The project
            components to accomplish these objectives include: 1)
            creating and structuring a superintendency of tax
            administration responsible for national internal and customs
            revenue collection; 2) facilitating taxpayer compliance by
            simplifying procedures and modernizing information
            technology, and establishing a network of taxpayer services
            offices; 3) strengthening enforcement mechanisms by
            reviewing and modernizing the legal and regulatory
            framework; 4) financing a social communication campaign to
            inform and educate the public, and provide feedback to the
            government; and 5) project coordination.
